column4: so i have a 6.06 cd in my cdrom.  and i ran apt-cdrom add, and ran apt-get update and apt-get dist-upgrade.  but it only wanted to upgrade like 4 packages.  what gives?
but is it alternate or desktop (live)?
it's the official kubuntu cd, official press
the kubuntu desktop CD is not suitable for upgrades
says it on the download page: http://releases.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/6.06.1/
i believe you need the alternate CD for that, or just do a a regular upgrade using the internet
that doesn't really make sense, since if i installed it from scratch using this cd it would install all the packages that i want to upgrade
the desktop (live) cds work completly different, they don't have packages per say, it's like transfering an image
so even with the ubuntu cd, you have to have the "alternate install" cd to upgrade?
that kinda stinks for people like me, but i guess it works well for most others
